Package ohos.security.keystore

Class KeyGenAlgorithmParaSpec

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.security.keystore.KeyGenAlgorithmParaSpec
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AlgorithmParameterSpec

    public class KeyGenAlgorithmParaSpec
extends Object
implements AlgorithmParameterSpec
    Sets algorithm parameters for key generation.

    The following parameters can be set: key alias, length, usage(purposes), parameter set for key encryption, attribute set for key access control, and key accessibility period after user authentication.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Security.KeyStoreProvider

    • Method Detail

      • getSecKeyAlgorithmParameterSpec

        public AlgorithmParameterSpec getSecKeyAlgorithmParameterSpec​()
        Obtains the algorithm parameter specification used for key generation.
        Returns:
        Returns AlgorithmParameterSpec, which is null by default.
        Since:
        1

      • getSecKeySizeInBits

        public int getSecKeySizeInBits​()
        Obtains the key length.

        This method returns the default value if the key length is not specified during key generation.

        Returns:
        Returns the key length in bits. For example, the default length of an AES key is 128 bits.
        Since:
        1

      • getSecKeyAlias

        public String getSecKeyAlias​()
        Obtains the key alias.

        This alias can be used to retrieve the key entry in the KeyStore.

        Returns:
        Returns the key alias.
        Since:
        1

      • getSecKeyCryptoAttr

        public String[] getSecKeyCryptoAttr​(int type)
        Obtains the cryptographic attribute set of a key.

        A key-value set is used. The specific parameters depend on the value of type.

        Parameters:
        type - Indicates the attribute value ID, which can be KeyStoreConstants. The value ID can be KeyStoreConstants#CRYPTO_PARAMETER_DIGEST, KeyStoreConstants#CRYPTO_PARAMETER_ENCRYPT_PADDING, KeyStoreConstants#CRYPTO_PARAMETER_BLOCK_MODE, or KeyStoreConstants#CRYPTO_PARAMETER_SIGNATURE_PADDING.
        Returns:
        Returns the cryptographic attribute set in a string array, for example, supported block cipher modes ECB, CBC, and GCM.
        Since:
        1

      • getSecKeyAuthDuration

        public int getSecKeyAuthDuration​()
        Obtains the validity period of user authentication for a key.

        If a key requires user authentication (see KeyStoreConstants#FLAG_KEY_ACCESSIBLE_NEEDED_USER_AUTH), this method can be used to obtain the validity period of user authentication.

        Returns:
        Returns the validity period of user authentication in seconds; returns -1 if user authentication is required every time the key is used.
        Since:
        1

      • getSecKeyUsagePurposes

        public int getSecKeyUsagePurposes​()
        Obtains the purposes for using a key.
        Returns:
        Returns the purposes for using the key, which can be KeyStoreConstants#PURPOSE_CAN_ENCRYPT, KeyStoreConstants#PURPOSE_CAN_DECRYPT, KeyStoreConstants#PURPOSE_CAN_SIGN, or KeyStoreConstants#PURPOSE_CAN_VERIFY.
        Since:
        1

      • isKeyAccessible

        public boolean isKeyAccessible​(int flag)
        Checks whether a key is accessible.
        Parameters:
        flag - Indicates the purposes for using the key, which can be KeyStoreConstants#FLAG_KEY_ACCESSIBLE_NEEDED_USER_AUTH, KeyStoreConstants#FLAG_KEY_ACCESSIBLE_NEED_DEVICE_UNLOCK, or KeyStoreConstants#FLAG_KEY_ACCESSIBLE_NEED_RANDOMIZED_ENCRYPTION.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the key is accessible; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1
